results.title: Discovery: Puri Puri
results.brief_description: An examination of the physiological consequences of the impact of Western civilisation on the peoples of Papua New Guinea. The program reveals the subtle and insidious ways in which the Western way of life has irrevocably disturbed the human ecology of Papua New Guinea, and suggests that, in order to achieve social and economic viability as a competitive nation, Papua New Guinea must achieve a state of biological fitness. Narrated by Robert Bruning.

results.title: Discovery : Explore the world of oil & gas (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: Take a first hand look at the oil and gas industry in Australia. You can visit areas such as; offshore production platforms, onshore gas and oil fields, witness the end use of gas and oil products, oil and gas reserves, processing products at the refinery, see how natural gas is created and trapped in the earth, and visit AMOSC (Australian Oil Spill Centre). There’s an historical overview, safety outline, and a chance to do some testing.

results.title: Discovery - penicillin
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Dennis Rich
results.brief_description: An outline history of the discovery of penicillin by Sir Alexander Fleming and its development as a human drug by Sir Howard Florey and Dr E.B. Chain. Uses archival footage and animated graphics.

results.title: Discovery
results.brief_description: A document in sound and image, with minimal narration, of northern Indian urban culture. Recording the gestural qualities of everyday life. The film-makers hope to find evidence of a divinity which animates all the drama and movement of a modern Indian city. The fine score is composed from a dynamic mix of field recordings.

results.title: Discovering the music of Japan (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Bernard Wilets
results.brief_description: In a beautiful teahouse setting, three of the major Japanese instruments - the Koto, the Samisen and the Shakuhachi - are shown. Historical background on each instrument and the ways they fit into current Japanese life are explained. Includes traditional Japanese singing and dancing, and a performance by an ensemble of the three instruments. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering the forest
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Presents the story of the forest community; discussing its conditions, forms of life and inter-relationships. The mood of the forest is established through its own atmosphere, sounds and life - there is no narration. Designed to encourage children to observe, and then interpret their observations.

results.title: Discovering texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Film Associates, Paul Burnford and Jack Stoops
results.brief_description: Explains that every surface has texture and than an object may have several textures. Points out that we learn about textures by touching the surfaces of objects and looking at the way light reflects from these surfaces. Shows how paints, tools and materials are used to change the texture of surfaces.

results.title: Discovering perspective
results.creator_credit: Film Associates of California, Paul Burnford and Jerry Samuelson
results.brief_description: We live in a world of depth and distance, which is called perspective. In drawing or painting on a flat surface, there are several ways in which to create the appearance of perspective: by overlapping and the placement of objects and lines, use of color, making objects clear or indistinct, and varying the size of objects.
